alert.note: Alert for Cherry; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 6:31PM CDT until June 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHERRY AND NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 530 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles north of Gordon to 7 miles east of Rushville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Clinton, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road, Hoover Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 94 and 131. Highway 250 between mile markers 21 and 37. Highway 61 between mile markers 215 and 224. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
